item.title: Trump Administration Gives Industry More Time to Adopt New Nutrition Fact Label
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The Nutrition Facts label on food and drink packaging has gotten a makeover, but you may not see the updates for a while. The FDA has delayed the compliance date after companies asked for more time.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The Nutrition Facts label on food and drink packaging has gotten a makeover, but you may not see the updates for a while. The FDA has delayed the compliance date after companies asked for more time. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/13/532819225/trump-administration-gives-industry-more-time-to-adopt-new-nutrition-fact-label

item.title: Nevada May Become First State To Offer Medicaid To All, Regardless Of Income
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The Nevada legislature has passed a bill that would allow anyone without health insurance in the state to buy into the Medicaid program, regardless of income. It's awaiting the governor's signature.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The Nevada legislature has passed a bill that would allow anyone without health insurance in the state to buy into the Medicaid program, regardless of income. It's awaiting the governor's signature. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532783189/nevada-may-become-first-state-to-offer-medicaid-to-all-regardless-of-income

item.title: Brain Cell Transplants Are Being Tested Once Again For Parkinson's
item.description: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532792500/brain-cell-transplants-are-being-tested-once-again-for-parkinsons

item.title: Long Waits And Long Odds For Those Who Need Social Security Disability
item.description: June 13, 2017 - The U.S. government has been struggling to balance a surge in applicants for disability benefits with shrinking funds. An updated application process could make getting benefits even harder.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - The U.S. government has been struggling to balance a surge in applicants for disability benefits with shrinking funds. An updated application process could make getting benefits even harder. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/531207430/people-with-unseen-disabilities-could-suffer-under-new-government-rules

item.title: What's The Difference Between Famine And Hunger? A Food FAQ
item.description: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/13/532277316/what-s-the-difference-between-famine-and-hunger-a-food-faq

item.title: Could Drones Help Save People In Cardiac Arrest?
item.description: June 13, 2017 - AED-carrying drones beat ambulance times to the sites of previous cardiac arrest cases in a rural area of Sweden, a study finds. But this has yet to be tried in real emergencies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - AED-carrying drones beat ambulance times to the sites of previous cardiac arrest cases in a rural area of Sweden, a study finds. But this has yet to be tried in real emergencies. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532639836/could-drones-help-save-people-in-cardiac-arrest

item.title: What's Next For Health Care In The Senate?
item.description:
June 13, 2017 - The GOP is working on a plan … but when will anyone see it?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-13/whats-next-for-health-care-in-the-senate
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Just Lost Your Job? COBRA May Be Your Best Health Insurance Strategy Now
item.description: June 13, 2017 - With the 2018 health insurance market still in play, you might want to extend your job-based insurance until this fall, when the outlines of the health law's marketplaces should become clearer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - With the 2018 health insurance market still in play, you might want to extend your job-based insurance until this fall, when the outlines of the health law's marketplaces should become clearer. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532637216/just-lost-your-job-cobra-may-be-your-best-health-insurance-strategy-now

item.title: Video: That Time We Tried Pore Vacuuming In South Korea
item.description: June 13, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tests out new experiences in East Asia. In this episode: pore vacuuming, a hot trend in Korean beauty. A suction pen excavates grime from your face.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - In NPR's Elise Tries series, correspondent Elise Hu tests out new experiences in East Asia. In this episode: pore vacuuming, a hot trend in Korean beauty. A suction pen excavates grime from your face. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/06/13/519107167/video-that-time-we-tried-pore-vacuuming-in-south-korea

item.title: Dog Owners Walk 22 Minutes More Per Day. And Yes, It Counts As Exercise
item.description: June 12, 2017 - A new study finds dog owners on average walk 22 more minutes more per day compared to people without dogs. The benefits of walking include a lower risk of heart disease and premature death.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - A new study finds dog owners on average walk 22 more minutes more per day compared to people without dogs. The benefits of walking include a lower risk of heart disease and premature death. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/532625213/dog-owners-walk-22-minutes-more-per-day-and-yes-it-counts-as-exercise

item.title: A Drugmaker Tries To Cash In On The Opioid Epidemic, One State Law At A Time
item.description: June 12, 2017 - The maker of one medical treatment for opioid abuse has successfully lobbied statehouses around the country to pass policies that tilt addiction treatment practices in favor of the company's drug.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - The maker of one medical treatment for opioid abuse has successfully lobbied statehouses around the country to pass policies that tilt addiction treatment practices in favor of the company's drug. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/523774660/a-drugmaker-tries-to-cash-in-on-the-opioid-epidemic-one-state-law-at-a-time

item.title: Is Zika Still A Problem In Florida And The Caribbean?
item.description: June 12, 2017 - The Zika outbreak in Florida is officially over. And cases are dropping across the Caribbean. But doctors say the risk to pregnant women there — whether residents or travelers — isn't gone.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - The Zika outbreak in Florida is officially over. And cases are dropping across the Caribbean. But doctors say the risk to pregnant women there — whether residents or travelers — isn't gone. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/531949066/is-zika-still-a-problem-in-florida-and-the-caribbean

item.title: A Pulse Nightclub Responder Confronts A New Crisis: PTSD
item.description: June 12, 2017 - The Pulse Nightclub shootings in Orlando a year ago killed 49 people. It was a horrific scene for first responders, and some are still struggling to cope with what they saw that night.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - The Pulse Nightclub shootings in Orlando a year ago killed 49 people. It was a horrific scene for first responders, and some are still struggling to cope with what they saw that night. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/531751457/a-pulse-nightclub-responder-confronts-a-new-crisis-ptsd

item.title: As Popularity Of Baby Boxes Grows, Skeptics Say More Testing Is Needed
item.description: June 12, 2017 - New mom Maisha Watson uses one of the 20,000 cardboard boxes given out so far in New Jersey. She's glad to have a safe spot for her son to sleep. But some question the boxes' safety and effectiveness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - New mom Maisha Watson uses one of the 20,000 cardboard boxes given out so far in New Jersey. She's glad to have a safe spot for her son to sleep. But some question the boxes' safety and effectiveness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/532132906/as-popularity-of-baby-boxes-grows-skeptics-say-more-testing-is-needed

item.title: Is Zika Dangerous For Kids? It Probably Depends On The Age
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Studies have shown that Zika can damage a fetus's brain in the third trimester. Would there also be an impact on the brain of a newborn?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Studies have shown that Zika can damage a fetus's brain in the third trimester. Would there also be an impact on the brain of a newborn? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/12/532083664/is-zika-dangerous-for-kids-probably-depends-on-the-age
